Description: If you have an item like an image, they need a text label (e.g., alternative description)
If the content is audio or video only, provide an alternative that presents equivalent information
Audio description is essentially an overlay on prerecorded content such as a video. Many streaming platforms support this and an easy way to learn is to turn it on.
The structure of a web page is extremely important. Assistive technologies like screen readers might look at the headings on a page to help the user navigate the page

The sequence in which content is presented can affect its meaning like paragraphs in a text. You want this to be correct so the user can understand it and tools like screen readers will present it to them in the right order.
Instructions in content should not rely solely on shape, color, size, visual location, orientation, or sound.
Color should not be the only mechanism by which information is provided
If there is an audio that plays for longer than 3 seconds there should be a mechanism to pause or stop the audio, or control its volume
